Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get excited about”
Reviews.Author: pacman74
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Concierge service - Comfortable beds - Good location if you need to be in the Pedregal area. Obviously very far from anything downtown (as much as 90 minutes in traffic) - Food at the two restaurants is pretty good if a bit overpriced Cons: - Some of the ads feature a pool but the hotel doesn't actually have a pool (they have converted it into a ballroom) - Only 1 of 3 treadmills in the gym was working on a regular basis - Hotel taxi service is extremely overpriced relative to the safe taxis that you can get at the sitio at the hospital behind the hotel. - Internet service is HORRIBLY overpriced considering that it is slow and cuts out frequently - Front desk service had questionable English and was not very helpful

Reviews.Title: “It hasl all it has to have”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business trip. Beds are very comfortable, breakfast ai all right, location is not too bad to be reasonable close to the center and to the airport (considering the lousy traffic in DF). Shame internet is not included in the rate and watch out if you have continental breakfast included in the rate as you may be offered a croissant and that surprisingly implies french fries (in the morning!), stuffed croissant with ham and cheese and increasing your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service! Great & Very Clean Rooms. Good Food”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_Contreras_R
Reviews.Content: I had to choose this hotel as it is next door to the hospital where we were to hospitalize a family member. I said we had to choose as I had seen the reviews and overall I was not looking forward to this stay...what an amazing surprise! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with an honest smile. The front desk staff was extremely courteous and they ensured our room was assigned in line with our reservation requests. As we travel with kids, we always order additional towels when checking in, and it usually takes about 20 to 30 minutes to receive them if we are lucky. The moment we walked into our room we found the housekeeper placing additional towels...that is quick and efficient service. At all points of contact, every staff member kept asking us if we needed anything else so they could take immediate action. The room was extremely clean, I can say hospital-like clean. Comfortable and very cozy. The food ordered from room service was surprisingly good, served exactly as requested, at the right temperature and brought promptly by a very friendly staff member. Yes, the food is expensive (about CAD$4.00 for a can of soda), but you also pay for the convenience as the closest restaurant is about 1 mile away. I do not complain about these prices, as they are available for you to see before you order, so at the end it is your choice to take it or not. It was worthy and convenient for me and my family. Location is not the best if you do not have a car and if you are a tourist. However, after my previous horrible experience at NH Hotel in Mexico City, I strongly recommend Camino Real Pedregal as the perfect place to relax and enjoy a clean room with outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and lacklustre”
Reviews.Author: golfing10
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by a seemingly good room rate in comparison to toher neighboring hotels. Once you get here they sting you for everything. There are no stores or restaurants close by and the pereferico is right out front. There is no courtesy bottle of water in the room and the 1l bottle costs $47 plus tax. There is no gift shop in the hotel where you can buy water either. To sit down in the restaurant on ground floor Bice there is a $22 cover charge per person then the prices for meals are ridiculous and service so so. Breakfast was a hoot - $55 for a glass of orange juice, $44 for a coffee. The breakfast i ordered was eggs benny but i had trouble finding the canadian bacon but it was strrangely served with french fries. the bar on the mezzanine floor is ok but drink prices are another rip off. Plus the tacos they serve did not go down well with me. The rooms are so so but there is internet free - must be an oversight on their part to not charge for it. All said, will stay at the royal or radisson next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: medquito
Reviews.Content: Real nice hotel. Good service grat food in both restaurants. Next time I'll be in Mexico I will go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unclean rooms and incomplete service”
Reviews.Author: erger78
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a trip sponsored by the government. For such a new hotel, the rooms seemed quite dirty. There were food smudges on the wall, and what looked like blood or some other dark matter smudged above the bathroom light switch. And there were many spills and stains on the floor. The bathroom sink had water stains on it, which suggested that it had been cleaned incompletely. Contrary to other reviews, I found the service quite friendly, if a bit inconsistent at times. Some services seemed incomplete--I never saw signs or indications of the pool that was advertised on the website, and the restaurant's prices were ridiculous. $35 for breakfast?? This isn't the Waldorf Astoria, and they could charge $15 and still keep out the riffraff. Good thing I was on an expense account. The hotel is in an extremely safe--but completely isolated and automobile dependent--part of town. I was lucky to have a driver, but if you don't you'll be spending lots of money on cabs, and will have to drive at least 30 minutes to go anywhere interesting. The nearest good night/dining spot is Charco de las Ranas ("croak of the frogs"). My hosts obviously wanted me to stay safe, but I would have traded some safety to be closer to the major sites. One other complaint is that the Internet speeds and connectivity were atrocious. I paid $12.95/day for internet (I had to go to the front desk to get a new password EVERY DAY), and I would lose my connection regularly. I almost asked for a refund. I'd bet it's the equivalent of a 128K ISDN connection. One positive rating: the beds were comfortable, and I slept quite well. I guess that's all that matters!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment...never again.”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in other Camino Real hotels over the years and have found them to be very good. This time we spent 1 night and got a very good price (aproximately $140 US for 3 pax) through Expedia although the rate they have posted on reception is $400 US !!! They claim to be a 5 star hotel which is overstaing the truth by at least a star and a half . The room had large stains all over the carpet which immediately gave the impression of dirt and since the hotel is widely used by the Angeles Hospital next door we did not even want to think about what the stains might be. The bathroom only had ONE hand towel although we had paid a U.S $40 surcharge for our daughter to share the room. and nobody ever showed up to turn back the beds which had enough bedding on them for Alaska in December. Our main complaint was that the a/c did not work: Since it was up in the 90Â°s the a/c not working quickly became an issue and we called reception for help and they said they would send somebody from maintenance. We waited and waited and eventually fell asleep as we had driven for 5 hours and my daughter had got off a 14 hour flight. None of us slept for long and sweated it out all night. The "courtesy" coffee in the room cost $35 MXP and we were astonished on checking out to be charged a 10% service charge on the coffee that we ourselves had made. We refused to pay it on principle. We also called for the duty manager to complain about the a/c and he was completely did-interested and never bothered to apologise. It is a constant problem in Mexico that the customer is NEVER right. We will never, needless to say, stay in this hotel again and anybody wanting a hotel in the south of the city would be much better off at the Radisson Perisur.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, well-kept and enjoyable, with a few extra fees”
Reviews.Author: kwrayprovidence
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and wasn't really sure what to expect, but overall, I had a very good experience there. I was there for two full weeks. The room was very well-kept with a huge window and a beautiful view out to the mountains. It was thoroughly cleaned and restocked every day, and the staff were very friendly when I ran into them. I had some initial problems getting connected to the internet, and I was disappointed to find that the fees were not included in the price of the room (this is unclear on their site). It ended up being roughly $10/day for internet, and I had to call the front desk every day to request a new username and password. I don't speak Spanish, which could have been why I had a hard time explaining what I needed. Enough of the staff spoke English pretty well, but certainly not all did. The restaurant on the second floor, Maria Bonita, is a taverna style restaurant with good food and a nice bar. The first floor restaurant is an Italian bistro that I only ate at once, and it was decent. You can also order any of the menu as room service - they were very prompt and I had some delicious room-service meals. The food at both is probably more expensive than local places (especially at the bistro), but not bad for a hotel. Online sources about the hotel are vague about the existence of a pool (I never found it) and a convenience store on site. I think both used to exist, but I'm not sure if either still does. You do have to pay for bottled water (although their water from the tap is filtered), but that's fairly typical at U.S. hotels so I wasn't surprised by it. Sitio taxis from the airport were in the $30-$40 USD range. For a business trip, it was perfect - I was also in short walking distance to my course, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “extremely poorly managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aliciachampan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most poorly managed hotels that I have ever come across! I stayed at this hotel bc of its location in the South of mexico city and was hugely dissapointed. The decor is agreeable but beyond this there is nothing else I can say. In the evening there was no management in the hotel, one felt as if they were living in a ghost hotel. If you wanted to speak to someone, reception could not even get a hold of anyone even if they had access. I felt very insecure. Room service was terrible, and even the reservations process was a mess. Dont send any of your clothing out to laundry either. If you can avoid this hotel do. I have stayed in many high-end hotels around the world, and I know mexico quite well ( I am from here originally so this is not a foreigner complaining).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RAB17
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel much better than I expected based on the other reviews on this website. I stayed in this hotel because I was invited by a university in the area that made the reservation for me, and I had no trouble with the reservation. The hotel is nicely decorated in a modern Mexican style and the rooms were very pleasant: well lighted (big windows), comfortable beds, marble bathroom tile, air conditioning that worked and was quiet, etc. The restaurant was good (not great, but OK), and when I ordered from room service it was also OK and arrived within 1/2 hour. I did have a little trouble getting the internet to work at first, but eventually I figured it out with help from the front desk (and realizing that the wireless worked better than the wired). Yes it costs US$9 per day, but that's not so unusual. It did help that I speak Spanish, so I can't say how well the staff speak English, but after expecting a horrible stay from the other reviews, I was pleasantly surprised at having a very nice stay. The only real problem with this hotel is its location on a major highway in the far south of Mexico City -- it's convenient to certain places nearby (the hospital next door, several universities, sports stadiums, etc.), but very far from all the main tourist sites, and there's nothing interesting you can walk to so you have to take a cab everywhere. But then, I was going to a conference at a university nearby, so it worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: fvaldesp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive. The rate paid by the organisers of the workshop I attended (Semarnat, the Mexican Environment Ministry) was over 250 US dollars per night. Even at this price, everything had a surcharge for the guest: thebottled water in the rooms, the coffee, Internet access. It might have been an expensive hotel but the attitude was extremely cheap. Overall personnel was rude and a laptop was nicked in the course of the two day workshop.

Reviews.Title: “Teribble-shocking-avoid!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chofola
Reviews.Content: Absolutly, the worst hotel i have ever stayed in !!!! No internet, the staff spoke next to no english.. They lost all my clothes with the laundry service and i had to leave the hotel. No money to change at the front desk to change for international notes.. The staff where generally uninterested in anything i asked for.. Avoid and make another choice...

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Nice - But Should Still be Avoided”
Reviews.Author: NYTMATTY
Reviews.Content: I am the author of a similar review below. I decided to give the Camino Real Pedregal a second chance because the hotel itself was nicer than my other options. Again, I left feeling ripped off and cheated. The stay did not start out well. When I arrived to the hotel I was told I did not have a reservation. Only upon production of a printout of my confirmation were they willing to help find the reservation. The entire process took about 30 minutes. My room was on the 30th floor. The hotel has 33 floors. Floor numbering starts at 21. I don't know why they number the floors this way. The room was fine, as expected, just like the last time. There was no bottled water in my room, though. Whatever. This did become an issue later on. Coffee is MXN30 per satchet as detailed in other reviews. I wouldn't mind paying if it was good coffee. But, it's not. At check out I was told that I consumed a bottle of water, and was charged almost MXN90 (USD$9.00). This was because when they put a fresh bottle of water in my room to replace the one that was never there, they probably charged me for it. They did take this off. However, I also disputed the room rate. The hotel confirms their rates in US DOLLARS. Then, they charge you a rate in Mexican Pesos, that is FAR in excess of any established exchange rate. They think you will miss this, and then leave. If they confirmed their rates in Mexican Pesos, and I agreed to the rate, fine. But, they quote their rates in US Dollars, and should charge you what you were confirmed. This is standard offer and acceptance. But, this hotel engages in "bait and switch" tactics. I argued with the clerk, but they refused to budge. I am going to be disputing the charge with my credit card company and will NEVER stay at this hotel again. They are crooks. And what is funny about it is that their fraudulent practices go on right across the street from the HQ of the Policia Federal.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: candybobo19
Reviews.Content: Room service super slow and horrible. Hotel staff not helpful at all. Tried to charge extra during check-in. Will never stay in this hotel again (rather stay in a cheap motel)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and double billing”
Reviews.Author: nscott6
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite for my best friends wedding night and asked staff to place some items(champagne, flowers and rose pedals) in the room for their special night. STaff assured me it would be done and it was not. They also double charged my credit card for the room and did not honor their free breakfast for booking the suite. Will never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but charges for in room coffee”
Reviews.Author: Pasqualinho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. The hotel is brand new (it doesnt appear live.com's aerial photo). The view is nice and unlike the other review found the road noise to be minimal. The restaurant was good, but with hotel prices. The pool was unheated and the pool area not very charming. Room service food was very good and the same price. The water from the tap is drinkable (if over chlorinated) -- I am a gringo and had no ill effects -- so no need to drink the bottle water. However, this is the only hotel I know which charges for the use of the in-room coffee packets. In general, you get the feeling that they are nickel and dime-ing you given their not cheap rates. There are no restaurants within walking distance and you should not stay here if you are a tourist: it is extremely safe, but boring here. (The closest simple place is a 1/2 hour walk along the periferico called el charco de las ranas. Not cheap but good.) Tip: there is a safe taxi stand (with much cheaper rates) behind the hospital. To get there, go out the side door, then walking to your right around the parking garage and one block along the driveway to the stand, which abuts camino santa teresa.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. Hotel is in Southwest area of Mexico City and quite near Six Flags facility. Property has recently opened. Camino is a Mexican chain, so English may not be widely spoken. Service was good throughout. Checkin is a bit slow, but this is Mexico. Rooms were good size, very nicely furnished and bedding comfortable. Bathrooms also excellent, well illuminated. Very contemporary/modern feel to entire property. Restaurant had excellent food. If this hotel is in the right part of town, highly recommended. Cab ride from airport is 240 pesos and takes 40 min. Hotel is located on busy street. Floor to ceiling windows (don't open) relatively quiet, but ask for room facing away from street.

HotelInfo.Name: Camino Real Pedregal
HotelInfo.Address: Periferico Sur 3647, Col Heroes De Padierna, Mexico City 10700, Mexico
